intro: Curio cicatricosus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant is typically evergreen, with a compact growth habit that makes it popular as a houseplant. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. The plant prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
